Previous: drāNext: drā2

√drā1 'run'

present: [2.] drāhi  

perfect: dadrus etc.  dadrāṇá  

aorist: [1.] drāyāt  dreyāt   -- [4.] drāsat   -- [6.] adrāsīt  

[future: drāsyati  drātā  ]

verbal: drāṇa U.+  

secondary: intensive: dáridrāti etc.  dādrā-   -- desiderative: didrāsa-   -- causative: drāpayati  dídrāpayiṣati  

derivatives: drá?  drāk? C.  drāpi? B.  dáridra B.+  

Compare roots dram and dru. The intensive stem daridrā is reckoned by the Hindu grammarians as a root, and artificially furnished with a set of verb-forms and primary derivatives.
